claim: Thus, in an attempt to bring our field closer to a shared approach to describing faculty or other populations in HPE, we present a template (Fig. 1), which we propose researchers and educators can use when describing participants in a faculty-related role.
title: Fig. 1.
caption: A template for describing research participants. Nota bene—Learners can be: medical students, clinical students, residents, lecturers. Site/institution can be: University name, clerkship location (e.g. ward, operating theatre)

claim: This template maintains the existing practice we saw of using a term to describe research participants and another which further qualifies that term (see Fig. 1).
title: Fig. 1.
caption: A template for describing research participants. Nota bene—Learners can be: medical students, clinical students, residents, lecturers. Site/institution can be: University name, clerkship location (e.g. ward, operating theatre)

claim:
Site/institution can be: University name, clerkship location (e.g. ward, operating theatre)Based on this template (Fig. 1), a completed example in the methods section of a paper might read as follows:
We included 711 full-time physicians who act as course coordinators for third year medical students at The University of The West Indies.
